column4: My ubuntu doesn't seem to save the monitor configuration (it's resolution).
Is there any way to fix it?
are you using Display to change your prefs?
what version are you using?
you should have a 'Displays' option you can launch from your dash
backup all of your data and fresh install 12.04 :p
do you see 'Diplays'?
nope, what DE is this?
desktop
is this LXDE?
I don't much about LXDE. I can give you some help with XFCE though :)
gnome 3?
From my experience XFCE is much more stable. Try install it via xubuntu-desktop
have you always had this resolution issue, or is it new with 12.10?
alright. Have you tried changing your resolution under XFCE yet?
Menu -> Coniguration -> Monitor Settings?
changed, but I think It will be wrong if I restart the system.
can you give it a shot?
now or when I restart it?
whenever works for you!
this? http://i.imgur.com/mbijT.png
is this after a restart? Does this work for you?
